greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest k such that the k-th triangular number has n^2 as divisor.
comment: a(2^k) = 2^(2*k+1)-1; a(m)=m^2-1 and for odd prime powers m;
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 26 2003
